title: Quiz: FQE July 2014 - Community Health
description: Final Qualifying Examination for Diploma in Clinical Medicine & Surgery - Community Health (July 2014) - Converted from Essay Paper

questions.question: Which of the following best defines a 'Community'?

options.text: A group of people living in isolation with no shared interests
A social group residing in a specific locality, sharing government and cultural heritage
A collection of individuals in a hospital ward
A random gathering of people at a bus stop

questions.explanation: A community is defined by shared locality, government, cultural heritage, values, or interests.
questions.hint: Think about shared location and shared values.

questions.question: Select the factors that hold a specific community together (Social Cohesion):
questions.explanation: Communities are bound by kinship, religion, economy, culture, and leadership structures.
questions.hint: What makes a village function as a unit?

questions.question: Match the level of malnutrition cause (UNICEF Framework) with the example:

pairs.right: Food insecurity and Poor care practices

questions.explanation: Immediate = Disease/Diet. Underlying = Household access/Care. Basic = Politics/Resources.
questions.hint: Immediate is the body, Underlying is the home, Basic is the country.

questions.question: Which of the following are recognized hindrances to exclusive breastfeeding?
questions.explanation: Hindrances include work demands, myths, stigma, and formula marketing. BFHI (D) is a *promoter*, not a hindrance.

questions.question: Calculate the RANGE of the following dataset: 15, 20, 16, 14, 28, 30, 15, 10, 16, 32. (Enter number only)
questions.hint: Subtract the smallest number from the largest.

questions.question: Calculate the MEAN of the following dataset: 15, 20, 16, 14, 28, 30, 15, 10, 16, 32.
questions.hint: Add them all up and divide by 10.

questions.question: Calculate the Standard Deviation (SD) for the data: 15, 20, 16, 14, 28, 30, 15, 10, 16, 32.
questions.explanation: Variance is approx 52.44. Square root of 52.44 is approx 7.24 (Population SD). If Sample SD, it would be ~7.63.
questions.hint: It is the square root of the variance.

questions.question: What are the effects of indiscriminate disposal of refuse?
questions.explanation: Indiscriminate disposal causes pollution, vectors, nuisance, and accidents. It does not immediately improve soil without proper composting.
questions.hint: Select the negative environmental and health impacts.

questions.question: Match the hospital waste category to the correct storage color code:
questions.explanation: Yellow=Infectious, Yellow Box=Sharps, Black=General, Red=Highly Infectious.
questions.hint: Yellow implies caution/infection. Black is for ordinary trash.

questions.question: What is the causative agent of Tuberculosis?
questions.explanation: Tuberculosis is caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

questions.question: Select the correct prevention and control measures for Tuberculosis:
questions.explanation: TB control involves BCG, DOTS, contact tracing, and ventilation. Boiling water is for water-borne diseases.
questions.hint: TB is airborne, so select measures related to air and immunity.

questions.question: Classify the following sampling methods:
questions.hint: Probability means everyone has an equal chance (random).

questions.question: Which of the following are the three components of the Epidemiologic Triad?
questions.explanation: The triad consists of Agent, Host, and Environment. Time/Place are descriptive variables.

questions.question: What are the major causes of Maternal Mortality in Kenya?
questions.explanation: Major causes: Hemorrhage, Sepsis, Eclampsia, Obstructed Labour, Unsafe Abortion.
questions.hint: Select the complications that kill mothers.

questions.question: Arrange the lifecycle stages of Ancylostoma duodenale (Hookworm):

items.text: Larvae hatch and develop in soil
Adult worms mature in small intestine

questions.explanation: Eggs -> Soil -> Skin Penetration -> Lungs -> Gut.
questions.hint: It starts in the stool/soil and ends in the gut.

questions.question: How can Hookworm (Ancylostoma) infection be controlled/prevented?
questions.explanation: Shoes prevent skin penetration. Latrines prevent soil contamination. Deworming kills worms. Mosquito nets are for malaria.
questions.hint: Prevent the larvae from touching your skin.

questions.question: Drug abuse causes problems in which of the following categories?
questions.explanation: Drug abuse negatively impacts health, society, economy, and legal status.

questions.question: Which strategies are effective in controlling drug abuse among youth?

options.text: Peer education and Life skills training

questions.explanation: Prevention (Education), Treatment (Rehab), and Enforcement are key strategies.
questions.hint: Select the interventions that reduce use.
